title: Plugin System Released (v2.0.12)
description: Anthropic released the Claude Code Plugin System, allowing users to extend Claude Code with custom commands, agents, hooks, and MCP servers from marketplaces. Includes /plugin install, /plugin enable/disable commands, and comprehensive validation via /doctor.

title: Claude Code 2.0 Released
description: Major release featuring native VS Code extension, /rewind command to undo code changes, /usage command for plan limits, tab to toggle thinking, Ctrl-R for history search, and enhanced hooks with reduced errors.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code is transforming AI coding in 2025 with its agentic capabilities

title: v2.0.70 - 13 CLI Changes
description: Released December 16, 2025 with 13 CLI changes including improved memory usage by 3x for large conversations, improved resolution of stats screenshots (Ctrl+S), reduced terminal flickering, added scannable QR code to mobile app tip, and added loading indicator.

title: Holiday Release - Layout Customization and Stability Improvements
description: December 2025 holiday release focused entirely on fixing bugs and improving stability. Includes core agent enhancements, improved layout controls with four default layouts (agent, editor, zen, browser), code diff viewing improvements, and Command+Option+Tab to switch between layouts.

title: Enterprise Features: Insights, Billing Groups, Service Accounts
description: Released enterprise-grade features including conversation insights (category, work type, complexity analysis), billing groups for fine-grained usage tracking, Linux sandboxing for agents, and service accounts for non-human API access and automation.

community_feedback.quote: Many of the largest software companies in the world have adopted Cursor for Enterprise

title: Wave 13: Merry Shipmas (v1.13.3)
description: Major December 24, 2025 update featuring SWE-1.5 Free for all users for 3 months, Git worktree support for parallel Cascade sessions, multi-Cascade panes and tabs, Cascade dedicated terminal (beta), context window indicator, and Cascade hooks for custom commands.

title: Gemini 3 Flash Available (v1.13.5)
description: December 27, 2025 release making Gemini 3 Flash available to all users. Combines Gemini 3 Pro-grade reasoning with Flash-level speed (3x faster than previous generations) and superior coding intelligence with 78% on SWE-bench Verified benchmark.

title: GPT-5.2 Available (v1.12.43)
description: December 11, 2025 update adding GPT-5.2 model to Windsurf. Described as 'the biggest leap for GPT models in agentic coding since GPT-5' and a SOTA coding model in its price range. Available for 0x credits for paid users for a limited time.

community_feedback.quote: The version bump undersells the jump in intelligence

title: Agent Mode and Multi-Model Support
description: October 2025 updates brought Agent Mode with MCP support to all VS Code users, multi-model choice support, smarter code reviews with embeddings, and new metrics capabilities. GitHub Universe 2025 announced Agent HQ mission control.

community_feedback.quote: Agent Mode became available to all VS Code users

title: Version 0.22.0 - Gemini 3 Free Tier Access
description: December 16, 2025 preview release (v0.22.0-preview.0) making Gemini 3 models available to free tier users. Weekly update from December 22, 2025 highlighted the holiday update with Gemini 3 access for free users and new features.

title: Version 0.24.0 Nightly Build
description: December 27, 2025 nightly build (v0.24.0-nightly.20251227) with legacy confirmation deprecation and refactoring changes.

title: GPT-5.2-Codex Released
description: OpenAI released GPT-5.2-Codex, described as 'the most advanced agentic coding model yet for complex, real-world software engineering'. Updated December 2025 and January 1, 2026 with WSL2 compatibility fixes.

community_feedback.quote: Mentions version 5.2 rolling out and discussions about weekly caps

title: v0.82 Released with GPT 4.1 Support
description: Aider v0.82 added support for GPT 4.1, mini and nano models. Notably, Aider wrote 92% of the code in this release. Earlier versions v0.79.0 added support for Gemini 2.5 Pro and DeepSeek V3 with improvements to tame Sonnet 3.7's behavior.

community_feedback.quote: Aider is self-writing, with 70-92% of new code in each release written by Aider itself
